\lyquidity\xml\xpath\XPathNavigator
jump to top

abstract
Package: Default
Provides a cursor model for navigating and editing XML data.
Implements

Methods

AppendChild(string | \lyquidity\xml\xpath\XmlReader | \lyquidity\xml\xpath\XPathNavigator $newChild) : void

Not used Creates a new child node at the end of the list of child nodes of the current node using the XML data string specified.

Parameters
NameTypeDescription
$newChildstring | \lyquidity\xml\xpath\XmlReader | \lyquidity\xml\xpath\XPathNavigator

The XML data string for the new child node.

Throws
ExceptionDescription
\lyquidity\xml\xpath\ArgumentNullExceptionThe XML data string parameter is null. InvalidOperationException The current node the XPathNavigator is positioned on is not the root node or an element node. NotSupportedException The XPathNavigator does not support editing. XmlException The XML data string parameter is not well-formed.
AppendChildElement(string $prefix, string $localName, string $namespaceURI, string $value) : void

Not used Creates a new child element node at the end of the list of child nodes of the current node using the namespace prefix, local name and namespace URI specified with the value specified.

Parameters
NameTypeDescription
$prefixstring

The namespace prefix of the new child element node (if any).

$localNamestring

The local name of the new child element node (if any).

$namespaceURIstring

The namespace URI of the new child element node (if any). Empty and null are equivalent.

$valuestring

The value of the new child element node. If Empty or null are passed, an empty element is created.

Throws
ExceptionDescription
\lyquidity\xml\xpath\InvalidOperationExceptionThe current node the XPathNavigator is positioned on is not the root node or an element node. NotSupportedException The XPathNavigator does not support editing.

Not used Gets a value indicating whether the XPathNavigator can edit the underlying XML data.

Returns
TypeDescription
boolean$CanEdit true if the XPathNavigator can edit the underlying XML data; otherwise false.
CheckValidity(\lyquidity\xml\xpath\XmlSchemaSet $schemas, \lyquidity\xml\xpath\ValidationEventHandler $validationEventHandler) : boolean

Not used Verifies that the XML data in the XPathNavigator conforms to the XML Schema definition language (XSD) schema provided.

Parameters
NameTypeDescription
$schemas\lyquidity\xml\xpath\XmlSchemaSet

The XmlSchemaSet containing the schemas used to validate the XML data contained in the XPathNavigator.

$validationEventHandler\lyquidity\xml\xpath\ValidationEventHandler

The ValidationEventHandler that receives information about schema validation warnings and errors.

Returns
TypeDescription
booleantrue if no schema validation errors occurred; otherwise, false.
Throws
ExceptionDescription
\lyquidity\xml\xpath\XmlSchemaValidationExceptionA schema validation error occurred, and no ValidationEventHandler was specified to handle validation errors. InvalidOperationException The XPathNavigator is positioned on a node that is not an element, attribute, or the root node or there is not type information to perform validation. ArgumentException The XPathNavigator.CheckValidity(XmlSchemaSet,ValidationEventHandler) method was called with an XmlSchemaSet parameter when the XPathNavigator was not positioned on the root node of the XML data.

abstract

Used Moves the XPathNavigator to the document node that the current node belongs to.

MoveToFirst() : boolean

Not used Moves the XPathNavigator to the first sibling node of the current node.

Returns
TypeDescription
booleanReturns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the first sibling node of the current node; false if there is no first sibling, or if the XPathNavigator is currently positioned on an attribute node. If the XPathNavigator is already positioned on the first sibling, XPathNavigator will return true and will not move its position.If XPathNavigator.MoveToFirst returns false because there is no first sibling, or if XPathNavigator is currently positioned on an attribute, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

string$BaseURI The location from which the node was loaded, or Empty if there is no value.
getHasAttributes() : void
abstract

Used Gets a value indicating whether the current node has any attributes.

Details
$HasAttributes
boolean

Returns true if the current node has attributes; returns false if the current node has no attributes, or if the XPathNavigator is not positioned on an element node.
